title: Hybridization-capture for nanopore sequencing

source.description: Split 40 ul eluate to 2 x 20 μL
Shear 3-5 μg DNA in 100 μL to ~2kb using the following settings on Diagenode bioruptor pico : 5 cycles, 4 sec on / 30 sec off
Split into two reactions to maximize the efficacy of the reactions.

Mix the following components in a sterile, nuclease-free tube:
AB
1Reagent Volume
2Fragmented DNA 50 μL
3Nuclease-free water 5.5 μL
4NEBNext End Repair Reaction Buffer (10X) 6.5 μL
5NEBNext End Prep Enzyme Mix 3 μL
6Total 65 μL

AB
1Reagent Volume
2Fragmented DNA 50 μL
3Nuclease-free water 5.5 μL
4NEBNext End Repair Reaction Buffer (10X) 6.5 μL
5NEBNext End Prep Enzyme Mix 3 μL
6Total 65 μL
Combine two reactions together in preparation for AMPure XP cleanup.

Incubate in thermocycler :
30 minutes at 20°C
30 minutes at 65°C
hold at 4°C
Add 65 μL of AMPure beads (1X v/v ratio) at room temperature.
Incubate for 5 minutes at room temperature.
Spin down briefly on a minifuge and place on a magnetic rack until beads separate out of the solution.
Carefully remove the supernatant, making sure not to remove the beads.
Keeping the tube on the magnetic rack, add 200 μL of 70 % ethanol in nuclease free water, being careful not to disturb the bead pellet.
Incubate for at least 30 seconds at room temperature
Repeat the wash steps (steps 9-11) for a total of two washes, and remove the supernatant (step 9).
Spin down on a minifuge to pellet the residual ethanol, place on the magnetic rack, and remove the residual ethanol using a P10 pipet.
Resuspend in 27 μL of nuclease-free water (25 + 2 to account for transfer loss.)
Incubate for 10 minutes at room temperature
Spin down briefly on a minifuge and place on a magnetic rack until beads separate out of the solution.
Retain the supernatant, which now contains the eluted DNA.

Add all reagents together as follows:
AB
1Reagent Volume
2Nuclease-free water 31 μL
3T4 DNA ligase buffer 20 μL
4Adapter Oligo mix 6 μL
5T4 DNA ligase 3 μL
6Template DNA 25 μL
7Total 85 μL

AB
1Reagent Volume
2Nuclease-free water 31 μL
3T4 DNA ligase buffer 20 μL
4Adapter Oligo mix 6 μL
5T4 DNA ligase 3 μL
6Template DNA 25 μL
7Total 85 μL
Carefully mix the reagents by pipetting up and down.
Briefly spin down in a microfuge.
Incubate in thermocycler, 20C for 15 minutes, then hold at 4C.
You can pause at this step and store the library at -20C

Purify the adapted DNA with 1.8X Ampure XP (v/v), and elute in 32 μL nuclease-free water.
Refer to Ampure XP Cleanup step.
Use 0.75% cassette high-pass for size selection protocol. (estimated time 45 minutes)
Let it sit ~45 min after elution for best recovery.

Add all reagents together as follows for two reactions:
AB
1Nuclease-free water 2.5 μL
2NEB LongAmp Master Mix 25 μL
3SureSelect Primer (brown cap) 1.25 μL
4SureSelect R Primer (clear cap in box 2) 1.25. μL
5DNA library 20 μL
6Total 50 μL

AB
1Nuclease-free water 2.5 μL
2NEB LongAmp Master Mix 25 μL
3SureSelect Primer (brown cap) 1.25 μL
4SureSelect R Primer (clear cap in box 2) 1.25. μL
5DNA library 20 μL
6Total 50 μL
Carefully mix the reagents by inverting a few times.
Briefly spin the reagents down on a minifuge.

Amplify using the following cycling conditions:
ABCD
1Segment Number Number of cycles Temperature Time
21 1 94 30 sec
32 12 94 20 sec
45530 sec
56512:30 min (50 sec/1 kb)
63 1 65 10 min
74 1 4 Hold

ABCD
1Segment Number Number of cycles Temperature Time
21 1 94 30 sec
32 12 94 20 sec
45530 sec
56512:30 min (50 sec/1 kb)
63 1 65 10 min
74 1 4 Hold

Purify the DNA with 1X Ampure XP (v/v), and elute in 15 μL nuclease-free water.
Refer to Ampure XP Cleanup step.

Mix together these reagents to make Hyb buffer, volumes given are for one reaction:
AB
1Reagent Volume
2SureSelect Hyb 1 6.63 μL
3SS Hyb 2 0.27 μL
4SS Hyb 3 2.65 μL
5SS Hyb 4 3.45 μL
6Total 13 μL/reaction

AB
1Reagent Volume
2SureSelect Hyb 1 6.63 μL
3SS Hyb 2 0.27 μL
4SS Hyb 3 2.65 μL
5SS Hyb 4 3.45 μL
6Total 13 μL/reaction

Make SureSelect Block Mix.
AB
1Reagent Volume
2Indexing Block #1 2. 5 μL
3Block #2 2.5  μL
4Indexing Blcok #3 0.6 μL
5Total 5.6 μL/reaction

AB
1Reagent Volume
2Indexing Block #1 2. 5 μL
3Block #2 2.5  μL
4Indexing Blcok #3 0.6 μL
5Total 5.6 μL/reaction
Prepare RNAse block solution by diluting the RNAse block 1:10 with nuclease free water. (7 μL needed per reaction)
In a strip tube, add 3.4 μL gDNA to 5.6 ul SureSelect block mix
Mix by pipetting, and denature the DNA on a thermocycler by incubating at 95C for 5 minutes, followed by incubationg at 65C for at least 5 minutes

Meanwhile, make the capture library mix :
AB
1Reagent Volume
2Hyb buffer mix 13 μL
3RNAse block dilution 5 μL
4Capture library 2 μL
5Total 20 μL/reaction

AB
1Reagent Volume
2Hyb buffer mix 13 μL
3RNAse block dilution 5 μL
4Capture library 2 μL
5Total 20 μL/reaction
Keep at room temperature briefly, and add to the denatured DNA while the DNA is still on the thermocycler
Incubate for 16 or 24 hours at 65C with heated lid at 105C.
Prewarm SureSelectXT Wash buffer #2 at 65C.
Vigorously resuspend MyOne Streptavidin T1 beads on a vortex mixer.
Add 50 μL beads (per rxn) to a 1.5 mL tube.
Add 200 μL of SureSelect Binding buffer.
Mix the beads on a vortex mixer for 5 seconds.
Put the tubes into a magnetic rack
Remove and discard the supernatant.
Repeat above for a total of 3 washes.
Resuspend the beads in 200 μL of SureSelectXT Binding buffer

Take out hybridization mixture from thermal cycler, add directly to bead solution, invert 3-5X to mix.
*If less than 20 μL hyb mixture remains after incubation, be wary of suboptimal capture performance.
Incubate hybrid-bait/bead solution on tube rotator at 10 rpm top-to-bottom for 30 minutes at room temperature. If sample is not properly mixing, mix with heat using a thermomixer at 30 C 800 rpm.
Briefly spin down on a minifuge.
Place on magnetic rack, remove and discard supernatant.
Resuspend in 500 μL wash buffer I by vortexing for 5 seconds
Incubate for 15 minutes at room temperature, occasionally mixing.
Spin down briefly on a minifuge, place on magnetic rack, and remove supernatant.
Resuspend beads in 200 μL 65C prewarmed wash buffer, mix on a vortex mixer for 5 seconds to resuspend beads.
Incubate 10 minutes at 65C
Briefly spin down on a minifuge, place on magnetic rack, and discard supernatant. Repeat the wash steps for a total of 3 washes.
Remove all wash buffer
Add 30 μL nuclease free water to each sample, pipet to resuspend. Keep samples on ice until next use.

Assemble PCR reaction, 2 for each capture reaction : 
AB
1Reagent Volume
2Nuclease-free water 5 μL
3NEB Long AMP MM 25 μL
4SureSelect ILM post-capture forward PCR primer 1 μL
5SS indexed primer 5 μL
6Bead-bound DNA 14 μL
7Total 50 μL

AB
1Reagent Volume
2Nuclease-free water 5 μL
3NEB Long AMP MM 25 μL
4SureSelect ILM post-capture forward PCR primer 1 μL
5SS indexed primer 5 μL
6Bead-bound DNA 14 μL
7Total 50 μL

Amplify using the following cycling conditions:
ABCD
1Segment Number Number of cycles Temperature Time
21 1 94 30 sec
32 14 94 15 sec
46030 sec
5658:20 min
63 1 65 10 min
74 1 4 Hold

ABCD
1Segment Number Number of cycles Temperature Time
21 1 94 30 sec
32 14 94 15 sec
46030 sec
5658:20 min
63 1 65 10 min
74 1 4 Hold

source.title: Oxford Nanopore sequencing library preparation (Protocol for SQK-LSK108 Kit)

source.description: Perform NEBNext Ultra II End-Repiar/dA-tailing in 60 μL.

Purify the DNA with 1X Ampure XP (v/v), and elute in 30 μL nuclease-free water.
Refer to Ampure XP Cleanup step.

source.title: Oxford Nanopore sequencing library preparation (Protocol for SQK-LSK108 Kit)

source.description: Purify the DNA with 1X Ampure XP (v/v), and elute n 30 μL nuclease-free water.

source.title: Oxford Nanopore sequencing library preparation (Protocol for SQK-LSK108 Kit)

source.description: Ligate on adaptors using NEB Blunt/TA Ligase Master Mix.

source.title: Oxford Nanopore sequencing library preparation (Protocol for SQK-LSK108 Kit)

source.description: Purify the adptor-ligated DNA following the protocol's specifications.

source.title: Oxford Nanopore sequencing library preparation (Protocol for SQK-LSK108 Kit)

source.description: Load on ONT MinION following the protocol's specifications and sequence for up to 48 hours.

materials.name: NEBNext Ultra II End Repair/dA-Tailing Module - 24 rxns
0.75% Agarose, 1-10 kb size selections or 4-20kb High Pass

description:
Large-scale genomic anomalies – structural variations (SVs) – are pervasive in cancer. Due to the scale of the SVs and the repetitive nature of the sequences usually flanking them, they are difficult to measure with conventional short-read sequencing. The long reads possible with nanopore sequencing provide an alternative to advance the understanding of SVs.
In this application note, we applied SureSelectXT to nanopore long read sequencing, enriching for CDKN2A and SMAD4 tumor suppressor genes, to improve the depth and variant calling accuracy of nanopore sequencing.
This application note focuses on optimizing the SureSelectXT protocol to long-read sequencing and using open-source softwares nanopolish and sniffles to improve the base calling accuracy and detect single nucleotide variants (SNVs) and structural variants (SVs), demonstrating the utility of SureSelect system on third-generation long-read sequencing platforms.
